job_description:
Our client in North York is looking for a Senior Front-End Developer.

Role

You are an experienced Front-End Developer with expertise in Angular (up to version 14 preferred). You will be self-motivated, dedicated, and passionate about technology. The incumbent will be part of a team of developers, software architects, project managers, QA, and subject matter experts in a supportive environment that encourages continuous learning.

Work Type

Hybrid 2 days a week in the office
Location: North York

Company Culture

You will be self-motivated, dedicated, and passionate about technology. You will be part of a team that builds cutting-edge solutions, and promotes and supports financial security for working Canadians. These solutions range from personal financial modeling tools to large, complex data management systems.

Key Responsibilities

Build high-quality code that meets business, security, and performance requirements
Support, update, and troubleshoot a variety of existing applications
Collaborate with a team of software developers, QA and Product Designers to ensure requirements and deadlines are met
Develop and support multiple projects as required, managing your own time appropriately
Participate in project management, including daily attendance at scrum meetings and ensuring JIRA tasks are kept up to date

Requirements

5+ years of work experience in front-end development
Fluent with Angular (up to Angular version 14 preferred)
Proficiency and hands-on experience with GraphQL, Typescript, HTML/CSS
UI development experience
Experience with version control software (e.g., Git) and issue tracking software (e.g., Jira)
Understanding of design patterns and frameworks, such as MVC and Entity Framework
Understanding of design tools (i.e., Figma) and how they tie into the front-end

Nice-to-Haves

Experience or knowledge of C# and .NET (some back-end experience would be an asset)
Exposure to MS-SQL, stored procedures, and database design
Exposure to Azure hosting and development environments is an asset
Exposure to middle-layer technologies including API and JWT

Education

Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
A background in actuarial science or financial mathematics, whether through education or work exposure would be an asset
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral

Salary

$110,000 - $115,000
Plus 10%-15% bonus
